info.title: ProPresenter API
info.description: Public API for controlling and retrieving information from ProPresenter.

get.summary: Requests a list with all the configured audio playlists.

type.description: Whether this is a playlist folder or an actual playlist.

children.description: The list of child playlists inside this playlist.

get.summary: Requests a list of all the audio items in the specified audio playlist.
get.description:
A maximum of 100 items will be returned per call. The `start` query parameter can
be used to retrieve multiple pages of items, by setting it to the index of the first
item to return.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The starting index in the list. If the index is out of range, the returned items array will be empty.

get.summary: Requests a chunked data update every time the specified audio playlist changes.
get.description:
This endpoint can be used to subscribe to changes to a particular playlist.
The response is chunked, where each chunk is a simple string "change".
This string will be sent whenever the audio playlist changes in regards to any of the
data returned by `GET /audio/playlist/{playlist_id}`. The updated playlist data can be
queried by recalling `GET /audio/playlist/{playlist_id}`.

Note that this endpoint will return nothing unless the `chunked` parameter is set to `true`.

get.summary: Requests the current capture status and capture time.

capturing.description: `true` if the capture is running, `false` otherwise

capture_time.description: The length of time the capture has been running for, hh:mm:ss format

get.summary: Performs the requested capture operation (start, stop).

parameters.name: operation
parameters.description: The capture operation to perform

get.summary: Requests the current capture settings.

source.description: The UUID of the source screen.

audio_routing.description: Audio routing for the capture stream.

file_location.description: The location of the file on disk (folder only, no filename)

encoding.description:
The encoding used for encoding the captured video. This must match one
of the encodings returned by the /encoding endpoint

url.description: The URL of the RTMP server.

key.description: The stream key to use with the URL.

encoding.description:
The encoding used for encoding the captured video. This must match one
of the encodings returned by the /encoding endpoint

save_local.description: `true` to save a local copy of the stream, `false` otherwise

file_location.description: The location of the file on disk (folder only, no filename)

event_description.example: This is a short description of the event.

encoding.description:
The encoding used for encoding the captured video. This must match one
of the encodings returned by the /encoding endpoint

resi.event_description: This is a short description of the event.

get.summary: Requests a list of all available capture modes for the capture type (disk, rtmp, resi).

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The required capture type.

get.summary: Clears the specified layer (audio, props, messages, announcements, slide, media, video_input).

parameters.name: layer
parameters.description: The name of layer that is to be cleared.

get.summary: Requests the details of the specified clear group.

put.summary: Sets the details of the specified clear group.

get.summary: Requests the image data for the icon of the specified clear group.

put.summary: Sets the custom icon of the specified clear group.

get.summary: Triggers the specified clear group.
Requests a list of all the configured clear groups.

post.summary: Create a clear group with the details specified.
post.description:
The UUID and index in the request body are ignored. They will be automatically
assigned and returned in the response body.

icon.description: Icon to show for this clear group. Base64-encoded JPEG image data.

tint.description: The color tint to apply to the icon for this clear group.

layers.description: The list of all the layers cleared by this clear group

stop_timeline_announcements.description: Stop the timeline on the announcements layer

stop_timeline_presentation.description: Stop the timeline on the presentation layer

clear_next_presentation.description: Clear the next presentation when clearing the slide layer.

get.summary: Requests a list of all the configured global groups.
Triggers the specified global group.
Requests a list of all the configured libraries.
Requests an array of all items in the specified library.

updateType.description:
The type of update this message represents:
  * `all` - The entire library, only sent as the initial response.
  * `add` - One or more items has been added to the library
  * `remove` - One or more items has been removed from the library

items.description: The items included in this update.

items.name: It Is Well With My Soul
It Is Well With My Soul

get.summary: Requests a list of all configured audience looks, except the live look.
get.description: The current / live look is NOT included. The current look can be retrieved by GET /v1/look/current. While the current look may have the same attributes as one of the looks returned by this endpoint, the current look will have a unique UUID which is not returned by this endpoint.

post.summary: Creates a new audience look with the specified details.
post.description:
The UUID and index are ignored in the request body. They are automatically
assigned and returned as part of the response.

screens.description: The list of screens in the look

video_input.description: Specifies whether the video input is enabled for this screen

media.description: Specifies whether background media is enabled for this screen

slide.description: Specifies whether the slide data is enabled for this screen

announcements.description: Specifies whether the announcements layer is enabled for this screen

props.description: Specifies whether props are enabled for this screen

messages.description: Specifies whether messages are enabled for this screen

presentation.description:
The UUID of the theme slide to apply to slide data on the presentation layer.
Not present or a null or empty string if no template is to be applied.
If a UUID is provided but a matching theme slide is not found, then no change is made to the currently assigned theme slide.

mask.description:
The UUID of the mask to apply to this screen.
Not present or a null or empty string if no mask is to be applied.
If a UUID is provided but a matching mask is not found, then no change is made to the currently assigned mask.

get.summary: Requests the details of the currently live audience look.
get.description:
NOTE: The current look is not contained in the looks returned by `GET /v1/looks` as
the current look gets special treatment in ProPresenter and cannot be deleted.
The current look may have the same attributes as one of the other not current saved looks, but it will have a
unique UUID not contained in the response of `GET /v1/looks`. If the current look's attributes match
those of one of the saved looks, the index returned is the index of the matching look in the
array returned by `GET /v1/looks`. If the current look has been modified and its attributes don't
match any of the saved looks, the index returned is the size of the saved looks array.

put.summary: Sets the details of the currently live audience look.
put.description:
The UUID and index in the request body are ignored and not applied to the specified look.
For multiple screens, the screens array is applied in order by index to the array of existing screens in the look.
Updates to the screens are done until either the end of the screens update array is reached or the end of the existing screens array is reached.
If the current look is not found in the saved looks (because it is modified but not saved), returns the size of the saved looks array for the index.

204.description: The request was processed successfully. There is no response body.

get.summary: Requests the details of the specified audience look.
get.description: NOTE: The currently live look is not found by this endpoint. To get the live look use GET /v1/look/current.

put.summary: Sets the details of the specified audience look.
put.description:
The UUID and index are ignored in the request. They are not modified by this operation.
For multiple screens, the screens array is applied in order by index to the array of existing screens in the look.
Updates to the screens are done until either the end of the screens update array is reached or the end of the existing screens array is reached.
NOTE: The currently live look is not settable by this endpoint. To set the live look use PUT /v1/look/current.

delete.summary: Deletes the specified audience look from the saved looks.
delete.description: NOTE: The currently live look may not be deleted.

get.summary: Triggers the specified audience look to make it the live/current look.
Requests a list of all the configured macros.

schema.description: The list of all defined macros.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the required item, either name, index or UUID.

get.summary: Requests the details of the specified macro.

put.summary: Sets the details of the specified macro.
put.description: The UUID and index in the request body are ignored. They are not updated.

red.description: The red component of the color, between 0 and 1

green.description: The green component of the color, between 0 and 1

blue.description: The blue component of the color, between 0 and 1

alpha.description: The alpha component of the color, between 0 and 1

get.summary: Triggers the specified macro.

get.summary: Requests a list of all the configured media playlists.
Requests a list of all the media items in the specified media playlist.
get.description:
A maximum of 100 items will be returned per call. The `start` query parameter can
be used to retrieve multiple pages of items, by setting it to the index of the first
item to return.

type.description: The type of media this item represents.

get.summary: Requests a chunked data update every time the specified media playlist changes.
get.description:
This endpoint returns a chunked response, where each chunk is a simple string "change".
This string will be sent whenever the media playlist changes, and the playlist can
be queried using the `/media/playlist/{id}` endpoint.

Note that this endpoint will return nothing unless the `chunked` parameters is set to `true`

get.summary: Requests a thumbnail image of the specified media item at the given quality value.
Requests a list of all configured messages.

schema.description: The list of all defined messages.

post.summary: Creates a new message with specified details.
post.description:
The UUID and index are ignored in the request body. They are automatically
assigned and returned in the response body.

message.description: The base string for the message.

tokens.description: An array of the substrings and tokens that make up the message detail.

get.summary: Requests the details of the specified message.

example.message: Text {text}, Clock {clock}, Countdown {countdown}, Countdown to time {count_down_to_time}, Elapsed {elapsed}

put.summary: Sets the details of the specified message.
put.description: The UUID and index in the request body are ignored. They are not updated.

id.name: Message with countdown to time timer token

trigger_message.summary: Triggering a message with multiple tokens

get.summary: Clears / Hides the specified message.
Executes the Find My Mouse operation.
Requests a list of all configured playlists.

post.summary: Creates a playlist with the specified details.

name.description: The name of the new playlist.

type.description:
The type of playlist item:
  * `playlist` - A standard playlist
  * `group` - A playlist folder, which can contain other playlists

get.summary: Requests the details of the currently active playlist.

name.description: The user-defined name of the item

parameters.name: playlist_id
parameters.description: The ID of the playlist, either UUID, name, or index, in order of interpretation and search priority. A path can also be specified to identify playlists within folders. UUID and name matches are searched through the entire playlist tree. Because UUIDs are unique a path is not necessary. A name path is not necessary unless there are multiple playlists with the same name in different folders. A partial path of names can be used as well. Indices only index into the immediate children at each level of the tree so an index path is requred to access playlists within folders if only using indices. A mix of UUIDs, names, and indices can be used for the path if desired.

by_name_with_path.summary: Match playlist with a name path

by_mixed_path.summary: Match playlist by a mixed path

get.summary: Requests a list of the items in the specified playlist.

put.summary: Sets the contents of the specified playlist.

type.description:
The type of playlist item:
  * `presentation` - A presentation playlist item.
  * `placeholder` - A placeholder item, used for Planning Center items that have not been linked.
  * `header` - A header playlist item.
  * `media` - A media playlist item.
  * `audio` - An audio playlist item.
  * `livevideo` a live video playlist item.

is_hidden.description: `true` if the item is hidden, `false` if the item is visible.

is_pco.description: `true` if the item is a Planning Center Online item, `false` otherwise.

post.summary: Creates a playlist with the specified details underneath the specified playlist or playlist folder.
post.description:
An 400 error will be returned if the specified playlist group is not
actually a playlist group (i.e. it is a regular playlist).

Performs the requested timeline operation for the specified presentation (play, pause, rewind).
Requests a thumbnail image of the specified cue inside the specified presentation at the given quality value.
Gets a list of all the props.

parameters.name: chunked
parameters.description:
Turns this request into a streaming chunked response. Each chunk returned by the endpoint
is equal to the standard response. Each time the data updates, a chunk will be sent, until
the connection is closed.

Most browsers can only handle 5-6 open connections per page. If more connections than
this are required, use the [/v1/status/updates](#/Status/statusUpdatesGet) endpoint, which functions as an aggregator
allowing the data from multiple endpoints to be consolidated into one.

schema.description: The list of all the defined props.

get.summary: Requests the details of the specified prop.

is_active.description: `true` if the prop is currently active (triggered), `false` otherwise

Clears the specified prop.

* `win`- Windows

404.description: The receiving machine does not have Network enabled or the requested path was not found.

text.example:
Amazing Grace, how sweet the sound
That saved a wretch like me.

notes.description: Any notes associated with the slide.

current.text:
Amazing Grace, how sweet the sound
That saved a wretch like me.

next.text:
I once was lost, but now I'm found
Was blind, but now I see.

post.summary: Aggregates the data from one or more streaming endpoints into a single streaming endpoint.
post.description:
This endpoint is used to overcome a browser limit on the number of concurrent connections allowed. The following
endpoints are permitted here:
  * [audio/playlist/{id}/updates](#/Audio/audioPlaylistUpdateGet)
  * [capture/status](#/Capture/captureStatusGet)
  * [library/{id}](#/Library/libraryGet)
  * [look/current](#/Looks/lookGetCurrent)
  * [media/playlist/{id}/updates](#/Media/mediaPlaylistUpdateGet)
  * [messages](#/Message/messageGetAll)
  * [playlist/current](#/Playlist/playlistCurrentGet)
  * [presentation/current](#/Presentation/presentationGetCurrent)
  * [presentation/slide_index](#/Presentation/presentationGetSlideIndex)
  * [stage/message](#/Stage/stageMessageGet)
  * [status/layers](#/Status/layerStatusGet)
  * [status/stage_screens](#/Status/stageScreensStatusGet)
  * [status/audience_screens](#/Status/audienceScreensStatusGet)
  * [status/screens](#/Status/statusScreensGet)
  * [status/slide](#/Status/slideStatusGet)
  * [timers](#/Timer/timerGetAll)
  * [timers/current](#/Timer/timerGetCurrentTimes)
  * [timer/system_time](#/Timer/timerGetSystemTime)
  * [timer/video_countdown](#/Timer/timerGetVideoCountdown)
  * [transport/{layer}/time](#/Transport/transportTimeGet)
  * [transport/{layer}/current](#/Transport/transportCurrentMediaGet)

In particular, all (and only) GET requests that return a chunked JSON response are legal URLs.

200.description:
The request was processed successfully. A stream of updates will be returned to the client as they
become available. Each update is separated by a CRLF pair, so a section of data followed by a
CR-LF-CR-LF sequence is one update. Each update is a JSON object, as below.

url.description: The URL that caused this chunk of data to be sent

data.description:
The data object that was returned by the given URL. This is in the same data format
as the given URL returns natively.

400.description:
The given request was invalid. This can be caused by a number of things:
  * The given URL was not found.
  * The given URL is not a streaming URL (i.e. it does not return a chunked response).
  * The given URL does not return a JSON data type.

The response body contains a list of URLs that were not valid.
